original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Coat a 9-inch-square baking dish or a 9-inch cast-iron skillet with cooking spray. Whisk the cornmeal, flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda and 1/4 teaspoon salt in a large bowl. In a separate bowl, whisk the egg, milk, sour cream and melted butter; whisk into the dry ingredients until combined. Fold in the scallions, broccoli and cheddar cheese.
Pour the batter into the prepared dish or skillet. Bake until the cornbread springs back when pressed in the center, 25 to 35 minutes. Let cool 15 minutes in the dish, then loosen the edges and slice.
ingredients: 1 cup sour cream or plain Greek yogurt
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
Coat a 9-inch-square baking dish or a 9-inch cast-iron skillet with cooking spray.
Whisk 0.38 cup of yellow cornmeal, 0.06 cup of all-purpose flour, 0.5 tablespoon of sugar, 0.13 teaspoon of baking powder, 0.06 teaspoon of baking soda, and a pinch of kosher salt in a large bowl.
In a separate bowl, whisk 0.25 of an egg, 0.25 cup of milk, 0.25 cup of sour cream, and 0.5 tablespoon of melted butter.
Whisk the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients until combined.
Fold in 0.13 cup of chopped scallions, 0.13 cup of chopped blanched broccoli florets, and 0.13 cup of grated cheddar cheese.
Pour the batter into the prepared dish or skillet.
Bake until the cornbread springs back when pressed in the center, about 25 to 35 minutes.
Let cool for about 15 minutes in the dish, then loosen the edges and slice.

recipe_title: Grilled Avocado and Tomatoes, Basil Oil and Cotija Cheese with Pine Nuts
original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Combine oil, basil, salt and pepper in a blender and blend for 1 minute. Strain into a bowl, discard solids
Combine tomatoes and onion in a bowl, add a few tablespoons of the basil oil and season with salt and pepper. Reserve remaining basil oil for Shrimp recipe.
Heat grill to medium heat. Brush avocado with oil on grill and season with salt and pepper. Grill cut side down until lightly golden brown, about 2 minutes. Remove to a platter, cut side up. Place some of the tomato mixture on top of each avocado, drizzle with more of the oil and sprinkle with the pine nuts and cheese. Garnish with basil leaves.
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
2 ripe beef steak tomatoes, halves and seeded and finely diced
2 ripe Hass avocados, halved and peeled and pitted
step_by_step_instructions: Combine 0.09 cup of olive oil, 2 basil leaves, a pinch of salt and a pinch of pepper in a blender and blend for 1 minute.
Strain the mixture into a bowl and discard the solids.
In another bowl, combine 0.25 of a diced tomato and 0.08 of a diced red onion.
Add a few teaspoons of the basil oil to the tomato mixture and season with a pinch of salt and pepper.
Reserve the remaining basil oil for another use.
Heat the grill to medium heat.
Brush 0.5 of an avocado with canola oil and season with a pinch of salt and pepper.
Grill the avocado cut side down until lightly golden brown, about 2 minutes.
Remove the avocado to a platter, cut side up.
Place some of the tomato mixture on top of each avocado half.
Drizzle with a bit more of the basil oil.
Sprinkle with 0.5 tablespoon of pine nuts and 0.5 tablespoon of cotija cheese.
Garnish with a few basil leaves.

original_instructions:
Put the apple, cabbage, garlic, chile, spring onion, and cilantro in a medium bowl. Pour over the vinegar, season with salt and pepper, and toss to combine.
Put the apple, cabbage, garlic, chile, spring onion, and cilantro in a medium bowl. Pour over the vinegar, season with salt and pepper, and toss to combine.
ingredients: 1 red chile, finely chopped (keep the seeds if you like it hot)
1 1/4 cups (300 ml) white wine vinegar or apple cider vinegar
step_by_step_instructions: Grate approximately 0.67 green apple and put it in a medium bowl.
Grate approximately 0.11 head of red cabbage and add to the bowl.
Crush 0.12 garlic clove and add to the bowl.
Finely chop approximately 0.12 red chile (including seeds if desired) and add to the bowl.
Finely slice about 1 spring onion and add to the bowl.
Pick and add about 0.12 handful of cilantro leaves to the bowl.
Pour approximately 0.16 cup (38 ml) of apple cider vinegar over the ingredients.
Season the mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
Toss all the ingredients together to combine evenly.

original_instructions:
Mix the flours in a bowl and make a well in the middle. Beat the eggs, olive oil and 6 tablespoons cold water in a measuring cup and pour into the well. Stir with a fork.
Cut the dough into 6 pieces; wrap 5 pieces in plastic. Roll out 1 piece into a 12-by- 18-inch rectangle on a floured surface (about 18-inch thick).
Turn the dough out onto a floured surface and knead until smooth, 5 minutes.Wrap in plastic wrap and let rest at room temperature, about 30 minutes.
Cut crosswise into 1/2-inch-wide strips, then cut the strips in half. Toss the pasta with flour on a baking sheet. Repeat with the remaining dough.
Photograph by Anna Williams
ingredients: 2 3/4 cups all-purpose flour, plus more for dusting
step_by_step_instructions: Mix approximately 0.46 cups of all-purpose flour and 0.125 cups of buckwheat flour in a bowl and make a well in the middle.
Beat 0.5 large eggs, 0.5 tablespoons of extra-virgin olive oil and 1 tablespoon of cold water in a measuring cup and pour into the well.
Stir with a fork to combine the ingredients.
Cut the dough into 1 piece, wrap the remaining dough in plastic.
Roll out the dough piece into a 12-by-18-inch rectangle on a floured surface (about 18-inch thick).
Turn the dough out onto a floured surface and knead until smooth, about 5 minutes.
Wrap the dough in plastic wrap and let rest at room temperature, about 30 minutes.
Cut the dough crosswise into 1/2-inch-wide strips, then cut the strips in half.
Toss the pasta with flour on a baking sheet.

original_instructions: Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add extra-virgin olive oil, 3 turns of the pan, then onions and peppers. Cook 6 to 7 minutes then add peas and cook another minute. Whisk eggs with salt and pepper then add to veggies and scramble to desired doneness. Remove from heat and stir in pesto then plate up and serve.
ingredients: 3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, 3 turns of the pan
8 rounded teaspoonfuls store bought, good quality basil pesto sauce
step_by_step_instructions: Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium heat.
Add 0.38 tablespoon of extra-virgin olive oil, then add 0.13 cup of chopped onions and 0.13 cup of chopped red bell pepper.
Cook for 6 to 7 minutes, then add 0.13 cup of frozen green peas and cook for another minute.
Whisk 1 egg with salt and pepper, then add the egg to the veggies and scramble to desired doneness.
Remove from heat and stir in 1 rounded teaspoonful of basil pesto sauce, then plate up and serve.

original_instructions: Heat olive oil in a medium saucepan and saute onion and garlic until the onion begins to turn translucent. Add rice and stir to coat with oil, onions and garlic, and let rice "toast" lightly. Stir in chicken stock and poultry seasoning and bring to a boil. Then reduce heat and simmer covered until all liquid is absorbed, about 20 minutes. Remove from heat and flake rice.
step_by_step_instructions: Heat 0.5 tablespoon of olive oil in a small saucepan.
Saute 0.08 cup of finely chopped onion and 0.4 cloves of finely chopped garlic until the onion begins to turn translucent.
Add 0.33 cups of white rice and stir to coat with oil, onions, and garlic, and let rice 'toast' lightly.
Stir in 0.5 cups of chicken stock and 0.17 teaspoon of poultry seasoning and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer covered until all liquid is absorbed, about 20 minutes.
Remove from heat and flake rice.

original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F.
Arrange the tomatoes on a sheet pan, cut sides up, in a single layer. Drizzle with olive oil and balsamic vinegar. Sprinkle the garlic, sugar, salt, and pepper over the tomatoes. Roast for 25 to 30 minutes, until the tomatoes are concentrated and beginning to caramelize. Serve warm or at room temperature.
ingredients: 12 plum tomatoes, halved lengthwise, cores and seeds removed
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F.
Halve 2 plum tomatoes lengthwise, and remove the cores and seeds.
Arrange the halved tomatoes on a sheet pan, cut sides up, in a single layer.
Drizzle about 0.33 tablespoon of olive oil and 0.13 tablespoon of balsamic vinegar over the tomatoes.
Sprinkle approximately 0.33 minced garlic cloves, 0.33 teaspoon of sugar, 0.25 teaspoon of kosher salt, and 0.08 teaspoon of freshly ground black pepper over the tomatoes.
Roast in the preheated oven for 25 to 30 minutes, until the tomatoes are concentrated and beginning to caramelize.
Serve the roasted tomatoes warm or at room temperature.

original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Butter a 9-inch cast iron skillet.
In a large bowl, whisk together the cornmeal, flour, baking powder, and salt.
In a standing mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, or with a hand-held electric mixer and a large bowl, combine the butter and sugar and mix until light and airy. Add the eggs one at a time, mixing well between each addition.
Add the cornmeal mixture to the butter mixture in 3 parts, alternating with the milk in 2 parts, until just combined into a thick batter. Using a rubber spatula, scrape the batter into the prepared pan and smooth the top. Bake until lightly browned and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, about 30 minutes. Set aside to cool slightly before serving.
ingredients: 6 tablespoons unsalted butter, at room temperature, plus more for preparing the pan
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
Butter a 9-inch cast iron skillet.
In a large bowl, whisk together 0.33 cup cornmeal, 0.17 cup flour, 0.67 teaspoon baking powder, and 0.13 teaspoon salt.
In another bowl, combine 1 tablespoon butter and 1 tablespoon sugar and mix until light and airy.
Add 0.33 egg to the butter mixture, mixing well.
Add the cornmeal mixture to the butter mixture in 3 parts, alternating with 0.33 cup milk in 2 parts, until just combined into a thick batter.
Using a rubber spatula, scrape the batter into the prepared pan and smooth the top.
Bake until lightly browned and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, about 30 minutes.
Set aside to cool slightly before serving.
required_tools: standing mixer or hand-held electric mixer

recipe_title: Traditional Supper Stuffing with Cider Gravy
original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Heat the oven to 325 degrees F and scatter bread on baking sheet, season with poultry seasoning and bake to toast bread, 10-12 minutes.
Quarter the apples and slice into each quarter on an angle to cut away the core. Chop apples into bite size pieces.
Heat a large skillet over medium heat with 3 tablespoons butter, when the butter melts, add the apples, onions, celery, bay leaf and parsley. Season with salt and pepper and cook until tender, 7 to 8 minutes. Add turkey to the skillet and combine with vegetables, heat through 2 to 3 minutes then fold in bread and moisten with about 2 cups chicken stock.
While stuffing cooks, melt 3 tablespoons butter in a sauce pan over medium heat and whisk in flour, 1 minute, whisk in cider and chicken stock and season with salt and pepper to taste, reduce 4 to 5 minutes.
Serve stuffing doused with 1/2 cup gravy.
ingredients: 4-5 cups farmhouse-style crusty bread, cut into 1-inch cubes
4 McIntosh, Golden Delicious, Gala or Honey Crisp apples
2 onions, chopped into bite size pieces
6 ribs celery from the heart, chopped into bite sized pieces
2 pounds roast turkey breast, 3 slices - inch thick from the deli counter, cut into bite sized cubes
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F.
Scatter approximately 1 cup of bread cubes on a baking sheet, season with a pinch of poultry seasoning, and bake to toast for about 10-12 minutes.
Quarter 1 apple and slice to remove the core, then chop it into bite-sized pieces.
Chop about 0.5 onion into bite-sized pieces.
Chop about 1 celery rib into bite-sized pieces.
Heat a large skillet over medium heat with 1 tablespoon of butter.
Once the butter melts, add the chopped apple, onion, celery, a small piece of bay leaf, and a pinch of parsley to the skillet.
Season with salt and pepper and cook until the mixture is tender, about 7-8 minutes.
Add approximately 3 oz of turkey breast cubes to the skillet and combine with the vegetables, heating through for 2-3 minutes.
Fold in the toasted bread cubes and moisten the mixture with about 0.5 cup of chicken stock.
While the stuffing cooks, melt 1 tablespoon of butter in a saucepan over medium heat.
Whisk in 1 teaspoon of flour for 1 minute.
Whisk in about 0.25 cup of apple cider and 0.5 cup of chicken stock, then season with salt and pepper to taste.
Reduce the gravy for about 4-5 minutes.
Serve the stuffing doused with about 2 tablespoons of the gravy.

recipe_title: Roasted Pears with Amaretti and Amaretto
original_instructions:
Preheat oven to 425 degrees F.
Mix amaretto and vinegar in a 13 by 9-inch baking dish. Put pears, cut sides down, in dish.
Roast pears 15 minutes. Add water and roast until pears are tender but still hold their shape, 8 to 10 minutes more.
Arrange pears, cut sides up, on a platter and spoon pan juices over them. Sprinkle with half of cookie crumbs, then baste with pan juices. Sprinkle with remaining crumbs and serve warm or at room temperature.
ingredients: 3 tablespoons amaretto or other almond-flavored liqueur
4 firm-ripe Bartlett pears, halved lengthwise and cored
4 amaretti cookies (Italian almond macaroons; 1/2 inch in diameter), crumbled
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F.
Mix 0.75 tablespoons amaretto and 0.25 tablespoons balsamic vinegar in a small baking dish.
Cut 1 pear in half lengthwise and core it.
Place the pear halves, cut sides down, in the dish.
Roast the pears for 15 minutes.
Add 0.08 cups of water to the dish and continue roasting until the pears are tender but still hold their shape, about 8 to 10 minutes more.
Arrange the pear halves, cut sides up, on a platter and spoon the pan juices over them.
Sprinkle with half of the crumbled cookies, then baste with pan juices.
Sprinkle with the remaining cookie crumbs and serve warm or at room temperature.

original_instructions: Heat a cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat. Add the butter and when melted, add the beans. Let the beans sit and blister for about 90 seconds, then toss and allow to blister some more. Add the soy sauce, toss to coat the beans and serve.
step_by_step_instructions: Heat a cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat.
Add 0.50 tablespoons butter to the skillet and let it melt.
Add 4 ounces green beans to the skillet.
Let the beans sit and blister for about 90 seconds.
Toss the beans and allow to blister some more.
Add 0.50 tablespoons soy sauce to the skillet.
Toss to coat the beans with the soy sauce.
Serve the beans.

original_instructions:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Halve the potatoes and place them in a bowl. Cover them with water if you cut them ahead of time.
In another bowl, mix olive oil, oregano, garlic, salt, and pepper. Mix well. Drain potatoes well and add them to the oil mixture. Toss with olive oil mixture. Spread the potatoes on a sheet pan. Roast for 30 minutes until potatoes are tender. Sprinkle with cilantro and serve.
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Halve approximately 0.5 pounds of Peruvian purple potatoes and place them in a bowl. Cover them with water if you cut them ahead of time.

In another bowl, mix 2 tablespoons of extra-virgin olive oil, 0.25 tablespoon of Mexican oregano, 0.25 tablespoon of minced garlic, a pinch of salt, and a pinch of freshly ground black pepper. Mix well.
Drain potatoes well and add them to the oil mixture. Toss with olive oil mixture.
Spread the potatoes on a sheet pan.
Roast for 30 minutes until potatoes are tender.
Sprinkle with 0.25 tablespoon of cilantro and serve.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Preheat oven to 500 degrees F.
Put the pizza shell or focaccia onto a pizza pan or cookie sheet. Drizzle shell with oil and scatter minced garlic over shell to edges. Cover the pie with a layer of all 3 cheeses combined and work all the way to the edge of the shells. Top with artichoke hearts. Cook 6 to 8 minutes, until cheeses have melted and begin to bubble. Remove from oven and garnish with parsley. Cut pie with pizza wheel or knife into bite-size squares and serve.
ingredients: 1 package thin crust prepared pizza shell or prepared focaccia, 16 ounces
1 cup shredded mozzarella (found in dairy aisle)
1 cup shredded provolone (found in dairy aisle)
1/4 cup grated Parmigiano Reggiano or Romano (a handful)
1 (15-ounce) can artichoke hearts in water, drained and thinly sliced
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 500 degrees F.
Place approximately 4 ounces of the pizza shell or focaccia onto a pizza pan or cookie sheet.
Drizzle the shell with about 0.25 tablespoon of olive oil.
Scatter around 0.5 clove of minced garlic over the shell to the edges.
Combine 0.25 cup of shredded mozzarella, 0.25 cup of shredded provolone, and 0.06 cup of grated Parmigiano Reggiano or Romano.
Cover the pie with the mixed cheeses all the way to the edge of the shell.
Top with about 3.75 ounces of sliced artichoke hearts.
Cook in the oven for 6 to 8 minutes, until the cheeses have melted and begin to bubble.
Remove from oven and garnish with approximately 0.06 cup of chopped parsley.
Cut the pie into bite-size squares and serve.

original_instructions:
Put the potatoes, whole, in a pot and cover with cold water. Salt the water. Bring to a boil, and simmer until very tender, about 30 minutes, depending on size.
Meanwhile, drop the garlic, bay leaf, and thyme in a saucepan with the milk, bring to a boil, turn off the heat, cover, and set aside to infuse 10 minutes. Pull out the garlic and herbs, and discard.
When the potatoes are done, drain them and peel while hot. Put them through a food mill set on the smallest setting over a large pot. Beat in the butter a piece at a time. Bring the milk to a boil and beat it in, splash by splash, until completely absorbed. You are looking for a very soft, fine puree, not unlike baby food! Check the seasonings, and serve.
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
step_by_step_instructions: Put approximately 0.33 pounds (150 g) of potatoes, whole, in a pot and cover with cold water.
Add a pinch of salt to the water.
Bring to a boil, and simmer until very tender, about 30 minutes.
Meanwhile, drop a portion of garlic, bay leaf, and thyme in a saucepan with approximately 0.17 cups (40 ml) of milk.
Bring to a boil, turn off the heat, cover, and set aside to infuse for 10 minutes.
Pull out the garlic and herbs, and discard.
When the potatoes are done, drain them and peel while hot.
Put them through a food mill set on the smallest setting over a large pot.
Beat in approximately 0.08 cups (17 g) of butter a piece at a time.
Bring the milk to a boil again and beat it in, splash by splash, until completely absorbed.
Check the seasonings and add salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste.
Serve the puree.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Heat olive oil in a large saute pan over medium-high heat. Add mushrooms, onions, and garlic. Saute until mushrooms are browned, about 5 to 6 minutes.
Stir in red pepper flakes and saute for 1 more minute. Add chicken stock and Worcestershire sauce, remove from heat and allow to cool.
In a large bowl, combine egg, panko, blue cheese, and mushroom mixture. Fold in turkey and combine. Don't over work or the meatloaf will be tough.
Shape into a long rectangular loaf directly on a sheet tray. Spoon tomato sauce on top of the loaf and shingle sliced shallots down the top. Bake for 1 hour and 10 minutes, and serve.
ingredients: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Heat 0.25 tablespoon of olive oil in a large saute pan over medium-high heat.
Add 1 ounce of mushrooms, 0.125 of a large onion, and 0.25 clove of garlic.
Saute until mushrooms are browned, about 5 to 6 minutes.
Stir in a pinch of red pepper flakes and saute for 1 more minute.
Add 0.03 cup of chicken stock and 0.125 tablespoon of Worcestershire sauce, remove from heat and allow to cool.
In a large bowl, combine 0.125 of a lightly beaten egg, 1 tablespoon of panko, 0.75 ounce of crumbled blue cheese, and the cooled mushroom mixture.
Fold in 0.25 pound of ground turkey and combine. Don't over work.
Shape into a small loaf directly on a sheet tray.
Spoon 1 ounce of tomato sauce on top of the loaf and shingle 0.125 of a shallot, sliced, down the top.
Bake for 1 hour and 10 minutes, and serve.

original_instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit Butterfly meat until about 2-inches thick around. Season with garlic and fresh herbs and spices to your taste. From the narrow end, roll tightly toward the broad end. Place fat or skin over roll and tie to secure. Bake for 20 minutes per pound. For a crispier skin, roast at 400 degrees Fahrenheit for the first 20 minutes then reduce heat to 350 degrees until done. Slice and serve as you wish.;
ingredients: 1 pork shoulder, boneless, roast with skin
Garlic, herbs and spices, to taste
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit.
Butterfly the pork shoulder until it is about 2-inches thick.
Season the pork with garlic, fresh herbs, and spices to taste.
From the narrow end, roll the pork tightly toward the broad end.
Place the fat or skin over the roll and tie it to secure.
Bake the pork in the oven for approximately 20 minutes per pound.
For a crispier skin, roast at 400 degrees Fahrenheit for the first 20 minutes, then reduce the heat to 350 degrees until done.
Slice and serve the porchetta as desired.

original_instructions:
Preheat oven to 350°F. Lightly coat a small baking pan with olive oil. Layer potatoes and onion in pan. Season with salt and pepper. Pour stock over potatoes and onion; cover and bake 30 minutes. Lightly spray or brush with olive oil and return to oven, uncovered, 10 more minutes to lightly brown potatoes.
Preheat oven to 350°F. Lightly coat a small baking pan with olive oil. Layer potatoes and onion in pan. Season with salt and pepper. Pour stock over potatoes and onion; cover and bake 30 minutes. Lightly spray or brush with olive oil and return to oven, uncovered, 10 more minutes to lightly brown potatoes.
ingredients: 2 large russet potatoes, peeled and sliced
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Lightly coat a small baking pan with olive oil.
Layer approximately 1/2 of a large russet potato in the pan.
Add approximately 1/4 of a large yellow onion, thinly sliced, on top of the potatoes.
Season with salt and pepper.
Pour approximately 2 tablespoons of chicken stock over the potatoes and onion.
Cover and bake for 30 minutes.
Lightly spray or brush with olive oil and return to oven, uncovered, for 10 more minutes to lightly brown the potatoes.

original_instructions:
Heat the oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add the red onion and cook, stirring, until soft, 3 to 5 minutes. Add the potato, cayenne, garlic, bay leaf, 1/2 teaspoon salt and a few grinds of pepper and cook, stirring, until the potatoes are well coated, 2 to 3 minutes. Pour in the broth and bring to a simmer.
Add bell pepper and tomatoes, bring the mixture back to a simmer and cook until the potatoes and vegetables are tender, adjusting the heat as needed to maintain a simmer, about 20 minutes. Remove from the heat, discard the bay leaf and let cool at least 5 minutes. Carefully puree until smooth with a handheld immersion blender or in 2 to 3 batches in a blender (do not fill the blender more than halfway full).
Reheat the soup and adjust the consistency with water if needed. Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot with a sprinkle of parsley and almonds and a drizzle of oil.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons olive oil, plus more for drizzling
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
1 cup canned whole peeled plum tomatoes, crushed by hand
Chopped parsley and chopped and toasted almonds, for garnish
step_by_step_instructions: Heat 0.33 tablespoons of olive oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat.
Add 0.17 cups of chopped red onion and cook, stirring, until soft, 3 to 5 minutes.

Add 0.17 cups of chopped and peeled potato, a pinch of cayenne, 0.17 teaspoons of minced garlic, 1 bay leaf, 0.08 teaspoons of salt, and a few grinds of pepper. Cook, stirring, until the potatoes are well coated, 2 to 3 minutes.
Pour in 0.58 cups of low-sodium vegetable broth and bring to a simmer.
Add 0.33 cups of chopped red bell pepper and 0.17 cups of crushed canned whole peeled plum tomatoes.
Bring the mixture back to a simmer and cook until the potatoes and vegetables are tender, adjusting the heat as needed to maintain a simmer, about 20 minutes.
Remove from the heat, discard the bay leaf and let cool at least 5 minutes.
Carefully puree until smooth with a handheld immersion blender or in 2 to 3 batches in a blender (do not fill the blender more than halfway full).
Reheat the soup and adjust the consistency with water if needed.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot with a sprinkle of parsley and almonds and a drizzle of oil.
processed_ingredients: 0.17 cup canned whole peeled plum tomatoes

recipe_title: Salt-Crusted Baby Potatoes with Ranch, Bacon and Scallions
original_instructions:
Put the potatoes and 1/2 cup salt in a large saucepan. Cover by about 1 inch with cold water. Bring to a boil, lower the heat and simmer until the potatoes are fork tender, 5 to 8 minutes. Drain the potatoes and return to the pot. Set aside to dry so the salt crystalizes, about 5 minutes. Keep warm.
Divide the potatoes among 4 plates. Drizzle with some Ranch Dressing and sprinkle with some bacon and scallions.
Smash the garlic on a cutting board, sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon salt, and, with the side of a large knife, mash and smear the mixture to a coarse paste. Scrape the paste into a small bowl and add the mayonnaise, buttermilk, chives, parsley, vinegar, scallion and black pepper to taste. Whisk well to make a creamy dressing. Use immediately or refrigerate in a tightly sealed container for up to 3 days.
ingredients: Ranch Dressing, recipe follows, for serving
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
2 tablespoons minced fresh flat-leaf parsley leaves
1 scallion (white and light green parts), thinly sliced
step_by_step_instructions: Put 113.40 g of baby potatoes and 2 tbsp salt in a large saucepan.
Cover with cold water, about 1 inch above the potatoes.
Bring to a boil, then lower the heat and simmer until the potatoes are fork tender, about 5 to 8 minutes.
Drain the potatoes and return them to the pot.
Set aside to dry, allowing the salt to crystallize, about 5 minutes.
Keep the potatoes warm.
Divide the potatoes onto a plate.
Drizzle with Ranch Dressing.
Sprinkle with crumbled bacon and sliced scallions.
Smash 0.25 clove of garlic on a cutting board.
Sprinkle with 0.13 tsp salt and mash to a coarse paste.
Scrape the paste into a small bowl.
Add 0.25 cup mayonnaise, 1 tbsp buttermilk, 0.5 tbsp minced chives, 0.5 tbsp minced parsley, 0.25 tsp white wine vinegar, 0.25 scallion sliced, and black pepper to taste to the bowl.
Whisk well to make a creamy dressing.
Use immediately or refrigerate in a tightly sealed container for up to 3 days.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Using a paring knife, poke 3 small slits into each potato. Bake in the oven for 1 hour and 15 minutes. Remove the potatoes from the oven and turn the oven temperature up to 425 degrees F. Let the potatoes cool for 5 minutes.
Using a fork punch some holes in the top of each potato. Press inward on the ends of each potato so that the tops break open. Divide the apple sauerkraut evenly between the potatoes and then top them with the sausage and Cheddar. Arrange the potatoes on a sheet pan and bake until the cheese is melted, about 5 minutes. Remove from the oven to a serving platter and serve.
ingredients: 1 cup leftover apple sauerkraut from the Turkey Sausage with Apple Sauerkraut recipe
2 leftover cooked sausages from the Turkey Sausage with Apple Sauerkraut recipe, finely chopped
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Using a paring knife, poke 3 small slits into the potato.
Bake the potato in the oven for 1 hour and 15 minutes.
Remove the potato from the oven and turn the oven temperature up to 425 degrees F.
Let the potato cool for 5 minutes.
Using a fork, punch some holes in the top of the potato.
Press inward on the ends of the potato so that the top breaks open.
Divide approximately 0.25 cup of apple sauerkraut over the potato.
Top with around 0.5 sausage, finely chopped, and 0.125 cup of shredded Cheddar.
Arrange the potato on a sheet pan and bake until the cheese is melted, about 5 minutes.
Remove from the oven to a serving platter and serve.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
In a skillet, combine vinegar, honey and stock with a whisk. Stir in bay leaf, onion, pepper, mustard seed and turmeric, stir and bring to a boil. Trim the Brussels sprouts and halve them. Add to stock mixture and season with celery salt and pepper. Cover and reduce heat and simmer 10 minutes, uncover and cook 5 minutes more.
step_by_step_instructions: In a skillet, combine 0.38 tablespoons white wine vinegar, 0.38 tablespoons honey, and 0.13 cups chicken stock with a whisk.
Stir in 0.13 bay leaf, 0.06 red onion (chopped), 0.06 red bell pepper (chopped), 0.25 teaspoons mustard seed, and 0.03 teaspoons turmeric. Stir and bring to a boil.
Trim about 5.33 ounces Brussels sprouts and halve them.
Add the Brussels sprouts to the stock mixture and season with 0.25 tablespoons celery salt and black pepper to taste.
Cover and reduce heat to simmer for 10 minutes.
Uncover and cook for 5 minutes more.

original_instructions: Melt the butter in a saucepan, add the flour. Stirring continuously, cook for 2 minutes, do not allow the mixture to color. Whisk in the milk and cook until mixture becomes thick. Add the cheese and season with salt. Rinse the green peppercorns well and add to the sauce. Butter a 4-inch spring form pan. Slice the potatoes about a 1/8-inch thick. Alternate layers of potato and sauce. Push down the layers as you go so you will get a nice tight torta. Wrap the whole spring form pan in aluminum foil, completely covering the top and bottom. Place in a 350-degree oven for about 1 1/2 hours, or until golden and cooked all the way through.;
ingredients: 10 Idaho potatoes (peeled and placed in cold water)
step_by_step_instructions: Melt 0.5 tablespoon of butter in a saucepan.
Add 0.5 tablespoon of flour to the butter.
Stir continuously and cook for 2 minutes without allowing the mixture to color.
Whisk in 0.25 quart of milk and cook until the mixture becomes thick.
Add 1.25 ounces of Gorgonzola cheese and season with a pinch of salt.
Rinse 0.5 tablespoon of green peppercorns well and add to the sauce.
Butter a 4-inch springform pan.
Slice 1 Idaho potato about 1/8-inch thick.
Alternate layers of potato slices and sauce in the springform pan.
Push down the layers as you go to get a nice tight torta.
Wrap the whole springform pan in aluminum foil, completely covering the top and bottom.
Place in a 350-degree oven for about 1.5 hours, or until golden and cooked all the way through.

original_instructions:
Let the steak come to room temperature for 30 minutes. Preheat the grill to high heat.
Sprinkle the steak generously with salt and pepper on both sides and grill over high heat, about 6 minutes per side. You're looking for a nice crust on each side, but to be true to the Fiorentina method, it should be rare on the inside. If you prefer not to eat your meat rare, cook it a little longer on each side, about 8 minutes per side for medium and longer for well done.
Then let it rest for about 10 minutes before you carve into it.
Cut the steak off of the bone, carving the strip off on one side and the filet off on the other. Then slice the meat against the grain and serve it on a cutting board or platter with the bone (true Fiorentina style).
step_by_step_instructions: Let the steak come to room temperature for 30 minutes.
Preheat the grill to high heat.
Sprinkle the steak generously with salt and pepper on both sides.
Grill the steak over high heat for about 6 minutes per side for rare, 8 minutes per side for medium.
Let it rest for about 10 minutes before carving.
Cut the steak off the bone, carving the strip off on one side and the filet off on the other.
Slice the meat against the grain and serve it on a cutting board or platter with the bone.

original_instructions:
Blanch the string beans in a large pot of boiling salted water for 1 minute only. Lift the beans from the water with a slotted spoon or sieve and immerse them in a bowl of ice water. Add the snap peas to the same boiling water and cook for 1 minute, until al dente, adding them to the ice water and the beans. Cut the asparagus into 2-inch lengths diagonally and cook in the boiling water for 2 minutes, and add to the ice water. Cut the broccolini in half, boil for 1 minute, and add to the ice water. When all the vegetables in the water are cold, drain well.
When ready to serve, heat the butter and oil in a very large saute pan or large pot. Saute the shallots over medium heat for 5 minutes, tossing occasionally, until lightly browned. Add the drained vegetables to the shallots with 1/2 teaspoon salt and the pepper and toss. Cook just until the vegetables are heated through. Serve hot.
ingredients: 1/4 pound French string beans (haricots verts), ends removed
1/4 pound sugar snap peas, ends and strings removed
step_by_step_instructions: Blanch the string beans in a large pot of boiling salted water for 1 minute.
Lift the beans from the water with a slotted spoon or sieve and immerse them in a bowl of ice water.
Add the snap peas to the same boiling water and cook for 1 minute, until al dente, then add them to the ice water with the beans.
Cut the asparagus into 2-inch lengths diagonally and cook in the boiling water for 2 minutes.
Add the asparagus to the ice water.
Cut the broccolini in half, boil for 1 minute, and add to the ice water.
Once all the vegetables in the water are cold, drain them well.
When ready to serve, heat the butter and oil in a very large saute pan or large pot.
Saute the shallots over medium heat for 5 minutes, tossing occasionally, until lightly browned.
Add the drained vegetables to the shallots with salt and pepper and toss.
Cook just until the vegetables are heated through.
Serve hot.

original_instructions:
Halve eggs lengthwise. Spoon yolks into a bowl. Reserve whites.
Mash yolks with fork. Add mayonnaise, honey-mustard, salt and pepper. Fold in bacon and cheese.
Fill each half egg white with yolk mixture. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.
step_by_step_instructions: Halve 2 eggs lengthwise.
Spoon yolks into a bowl. Reserve the whites.
Mash yolks with fork.
Add 0.67 tablespoon mayonnaise, 0.08 tablespoon honey mustard, 0.04 teaspoon salt, and 0.02 teaspoon black pepper.
Fold in 0.67 strip bacon, crumbled, and 0.33 tablespoon shredded sharp Cheddar.
Fill each half egg white with yolk mixture.
Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.

original_instructions: In a tall stockpot, bring all the ingredients except the salt, pepper, and butter to a boil. Lower the heat and simmer for 30 minutes, or until each vegetable is easily pierced by the point of a knife. Pass soup through the medium disc of a food mill. Or skim the vegetables out of the liquid, pulse to a coarse puree in a food processor, and recombine the vegetables with the liquid. Season with salt and pepper. The soup can be refrigerated at this point for up to 4 days or frozen for up to 2 months. Bring the soup to a simmer. Stir in the butter just before serving.;
ingredients: 1 3/4 pounds spinach, stemmed and washed well
2 pounds potatoes, peeled, halved lengthwise, and cut across into slices
10 cups basic chicken stock, or commercial low sodium chicken broth
Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
step_by_step_instructions: In a tall stockpot, combine approximately 70g spinach, 80g potatoes, 50g carrots, 20g onions, 400ml chicken stock, and 1/4 clove garlic. Bring to a boil.
Lower the heat and simmer for 30 minutes, or until each vegetable is easily pierced by the point of a knife.
Pass the soup through the medium disc of a food mill, or skim the vegetables out of the liquid and pulse to a coarse puree in a food processor, then recombine with the liquid.
Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste.
Bring the soup to a simmer again.
Stir in approximately 1 teaspoon of unsalted butter just before serving.

recipe_title: Char Grilled Hmong Black Pig Skewers with Sesame Salt: Thit Lon Nuong Muoi Vung
original_instructions:
Special equipment: 12 bamboo skewers, soaked in water for 30 minutes
Mix the sesame seeds with salt.
Place the spring onions, lemongrass, sugar, black pepper, vegetable oil, fish sauce, honey, and oyster sauce in a mixing bowl and stir to combine. Add the pork, toss to coat, then cover and marinate in the refrigerator overnight.
Preheat a grill. Thread the pork onto bamboo skewers and char grill each side for 3 minutes.
Dip into sesame salt.
ingredients: 10 1/2 ounces/300 g pork neck, finely sliced
step_by_step_instructions: Mix 0.33 tablespoons sesame seeds with 0.17 teaspoons salt.

Place 0.33 spring onions, 1.33 tablespoons lemongrass, 0.33 tablespoons sugar, 0.17 teaspoons black pepper, 1 tablespoon vegetable oil, 1 tablespoon fish sauce, 0.33 tablespoons honey, and 0.33 teaspoons oyster sauce in a mixing bowl and stir to combine.
Add 3.5 ounces pork to the bowl, toss to coat, then cover and marinate in the refrigerator overnight.
Preheat a grill.
Thread the pork onto bamboo skewers and char grill each side for 3 minutes.
Dip into sesame salt.

original_instructions:
Preheat oven to 325 degrees.
Trim and wash the spinach. In a large pot of salted, boiling water add spinach. Simmer the spinach, stirring occasionally, for 10 minutes. Then drain, refresh, and squeeze dry.
Saute the onions in the butter until tender. Add the cooked spinach, sour cream, cream cheese, grated Parmesan cheese, salt, pepper and nutmeg to taste. Transfer mixture to a buttered baking dish.
Saute 1/2 cup bread crumbs in 2 tablespoons of butter until browned. Sprinkle bread crumbs on spinach. Put it in the oven and bake for 20 minutes, then serve.
Suggested drink: Beck's Beer
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 325 degrees.
Trim and wash approximately 0.5 pounds of fresh spinach.
In a large pot of salted, boiling water, add the spinach.
Simmer the spinach, stirring occasionally, for about 10 minutes.
Drain the spinach, refresh with cold water, and squeeze dry.
Saute about 0.12 of a small onion (diced) in 0.5 tablespoons of butter until tender.
Add the cooked spinach, 1 tablespoon of sour cream, 0.25 pound of cream cheese, 0.12 cup of grated Parmesan cheese, salt, pepper, and a pinch of nutmeg to taste, and mix well.
Transfer the mixture to a small buttered baking dish.
Saute 0.12 cup of bread crumbs in 0.5 tablespoons of butter until browned.
Sprinkle the browned bread crumbs over the spinach mixture.
Put the dish in the oven and bake for 20 minutes.
Serve immediately.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a saute pan over medium-high heat, add the olive oil, sausage and shallots. Saute until browned, breaking up the sausage into small pieces with a wooden spoon, 5 to 7 minutes.
Add the browned sausage and reserved mushroom stems to the bowl of a food processor and pulse until combined. Add the pine nuts and pulse a few more times until slightly smooth. Transfer to a mixing bowl and fold in the Swiss cheese, Gruyere and cream.
Add the breadcrumbs and parsley to a small bowl and mix to combine.
Place the mushroom caps hollow-side up on the prepared baking sheet. Using a tablespoon, spoon the mushroom and sausage mixture into each mushroom cap. Top with the breadcrumb mixture. Bake until golden brown, about 20 minutes.
ingredients: 20 large white mushrooms, stems removed and reserved
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a saute pan over medium-high heat, add approximately 0.13 tablespoon olive oil, 1.33 ounces sausage, and a small portion of chopped shallots (about 0.05 ounce).
Saute until browned, breaking up the sausage into small pieces, for about 5 to 7 minutes.
Transfer the browned sausage and an estimated 1.33 mushroom stems to a food processor and pulse until combined.
Add approximately 0.02 ounce pine nuts to the processor and pulse a few more times until slightly smooth.
Transfer the mixture to a mixing bowl and fold in about 0.05 cup Swiss cheese, 0.03 cup Gruyere cheese, and 0.03 cup heavy cream.
In a small bowl, mix about 0.03 cup breadcrumbs and 0.01 tablespoon chopped parsley to combine.
Place approximately 1 mushroom cap hollow-side up on the prepared baking sheet.
Using a tablespoon, spoon the mushroom and sausage mixture into the mushroom cap.
Top with the breadcrumb mixture.
Bake until golden brown, about 20 minutes.

original_instructions:
Halve each cucumber horizontally, then each half vertically in 4 to make 32 pieces in all. Rub them all over with salt and set aside to drain in a colander for 1 hour. In a medium bowl combine remaining ingredients.
Rinse cucumbers with cold water, drain well and pat dry. Taste for seasoning and salt lightly if no salty flavor remains. Toss with dressing. Transfer to a 1-pint jar and cover tightly. Let sit at room temperature for 24 hours before serving. Can be made several weeks ahead and refrigerated.
ingredients: 3 tablespoons salted baby shrimp (saewoo jut), chopped
step_by_step_instructions: Halve each cucumber horizontally, then each half vertically to make 8 pieces in total.
Rub the cucumber pieces all over with approximately 0.38 tablespoon of coarse salt.
Set the salted cucumber pieces aside to drain in a colander for 1 hour.

In a medium bowl, combine about 0.13 small onion (finely chopped), 1 Chinese chive (cut into 1-inch pieces), 0.38 scallion (finely chopped), 0.03 cup finely-minced carrot, 0.25 tablespoon salted baby shrimp (chopped), 0.25 tablespoon hot red chili powder, 0.25 tablespoon hot water, 0.17 teaspoon very finely-minced garlic, and 0.08 teaspoon finely-minced ginger.
Rinse the cucumbers with cold water, drain well, and pat dry.
Taste the cucumbers for seasoning and salt lightly if no salty flavor remains.
Toss the cucumbers with the dressing.
Transfer the dressed cucumbers to a small jar and cover tightly.
Let the jar sit at room temperature for 24 hours before serving.

original_instructions:
BEAT egg with wire whisk in small microwaveable bowl. Stir in bacon and peppers. Microwave on HIGH 1 min., stirring after 30 sec. Let stand 1 min. or until egg is set and no visible liquid remains.
SPRAY medium skillet with cooking spray; add tortilla. Spoon egg mixture onto half of the tortilla; sprinkle with cheese. Cook on medium heat 2 to 3 min. or until tortilla is lightly browned and cheese is melted.
FOLD tortilla in half to serve.
Add a little curl to your bacon, and make breakfast or other dishes even more special!
While bacon is still very warm right after draining on paper towels, wrap each cooked slice around the tines of a metal fork. Cool completely. Then, remove bacon curls from forks and use as a garnish for salads, potato and pasta dishes, and meat entrees.
ingredients: 3 OSCAR MAYER Bacon slices, cooked and cut into 1/2-inch pieces
1 tbsp. chopped mixed red and green peppers
2 tbsp. shredded Colby & Monterey Jack Cheese
step_by_step_instructions: Beat 1 egg with a wire whisk in a small microwaveable bowl.
Stir in 3 cooked bacon slices cut into 1/2-inch pieces and 1 tablespoon of chopped mixed red and green peppers.
Microwave on HIGH for 1 minute, stirring after 30 seconds.
Let stand for 1 minute or until the egg is set and no visible liquid remains.
Spray a medium skillet with cooking spray and add 1 whole wheat tortilla.
Spoon the egg mixture onto half of the tortilla and sprinkle with 2 tablespoons of shredded Colby & Monterey Jack Cheese.
Cook on medium heat for 2 to 3 minutes or until the tortilla is lightly browned and the cheese is melted.
Fold the tortilla in half to serve.

original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Wrap the beets individually in tin foil and roast directly on the rack in the oven until tender, about 1 hour. Open the foil packets and let cool. Once they're cool, peel the beets and cut into small chunks.
In a large bowl, whisk together the olive oil, vinegar, honey, red onion, and mustard. Season with salt and pepper. Add the beets and spinach to the dressing and toss to coat. Transfer the salad to a platter or plates, top with the goat cheese and walnuts, and serve.
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
Wrap 1 medium beet (approximately 3.3 oz) individually in tin foil.
Roast the beet directly on the rack in the oven until tender, about 1 hour.
Open the foil packet and let the beet cool.
Once cool, peel the beet and cut into small chunks.
In a large bowl, whisk together 2 tbsp of olive oil, 1 tsp of sherry vinegar, 0.5 tsp of honey, 0.25 tsp of minced red onion, and 0.08 tsp of Dijon mustard.
Season the dressing with a pinch of salt and a pinch of freshly ground black pepper.
Add the beet chunks and 1 cup of baby spinach to the dressing and toss to coat.
Transfer the salad to a plate, top with 1.33 tbsp of crumbled goat cheese and 1.33 tbsp of coarsely chopped toasted walnuts.
Serve the salad.

original_instructions:
Combine all spices in a bowl. Rub the entire chicken with the spice rub, including the cavity, and set aside while you prepare the grill.
Set up a charcoal grill for indirect grilling. Throw the soaked wood chips on the hot coals. Place the cover on the grill and adjust the vents holes on the top and bottom to obtain the desired temperature (in this case it should be about 350 degrees F).
Place the chicken on the rack of the grill opposite the coals and smoke until the chicken reaches an internal temperature of 160 degrees F, using an instant-read thermometer, about 2 to 2 1/2 hours. Remove from the grill, tent loosely with foil, and let rest 10 minutes before carving.
ingredients: 1 cup applewood or hickory wood chips, soaked in water for 10 minutes
step_by_step_instructions: Combine all spices in a bowl.
Rub the entire chicken with the spice rub, including the cavity.
Set aside the chicken while you prepare the grill.
Set up a charcoal grill for indirect grilling.
Throw the soaked wood chips on the hot coals.
Place the cover on the grill and adjust the vents holes on the top and bottom to obtain the desired temperature of about 350 degrees F.
Place the chicken on the rack of the grill opposite the coals.
Smoke until the chicken reaches an internal temperature of 160 degrees F, about 2 to 2 1/2 hours.
Remove from the grill, tent loosely with foil, and let rest 10 minutes before carving.
processed_ingredients: 0.13 cup applewood or hickory wood chips

original_instructions:
Combine 1 Tbsp. soy sauce, 1 Tbsp. cornstarch, 1/2 teaspoon sugar and garlic; stir in chicken. Let stand 15 minutes.
Meanwhile, blend remaining 2 Tbsp. soy sauce, 1 Tbsp. cornstarch, 2 teaspoons sugar and vinegar with 3/4 cup water.
Remove flowerets from broccoli; cut into bite-size pieces. Peel stalks; cut diagonally into thin slices.
Heat 1 Tbsp. oil in hot wok or large skillet over high heat. Add chicken and stir-fry 3 minutes; remove.
Heat remaining 1 Tbsp. oil in same pan. Add broccoli, onion, carrot and red pepper; stir-fry 3 minutes. Add snow peas; stir-fry 2 minutes longer. Stir in chicken and soy sauce mixture. Cook, stirring, until sauce boils and thickens
ingredients: 2 boneless, skinless chicken breast halves, cut into 1-inch squares
1 small carrot, cut diagonally into thin slices
1/4 pound fresh snow peas, trimmed and cut in half
step_by_step_instructions: Combine 0.5 tablespoon soy sauce, 0.5 tablespoon cornstarch, 0.08 teaspoon sugar, and garlic; stir in chicken. Let stand for 15 minutes.
Meanwhile, blend 1 tablespoon soy sauce, 0.5 tablespoon cornstarch, 0.3 teaspoon sugar, and vinegar with 0.125 cup water.
Remove flowerets from broccoli; cut into bite-size pieces. Peel stalks; cut diagonally into thin slices.
Heat 0.5 tablespoon oil in a hot wok or large skillet over high heat. Add chicken and stir-fry for 3 minutes; remove.
Heat remaining 0.5 tablespoon oil in the same pan. Add broccoli, onion, carrot, and red pepper; stir-fry for 3 minutes.
Add snow peas; stir-fry for 2 minutes longer.
Stir in chicken and soy sauce mixture. Cook, stirring, until sauce boils and thickens.

recipe_title: Cornbread Stuffing with Sausage and Apples
original_instructions: Saute sausage until brown. Remove from pan and place in a large mixing bowl. Saute onions and celery in butter. Add sage, rosemary and thyme. When the mixture is softened, about 3 minutes, put into bowl with sausage. Add the remaining ingredients to the mixing bowl. It mixture is too dry add more stock.
ingredients: 1 large peeled, cored and diced apple
step_by_step_instructions: Saute approximately 0.08 pound of sausage in a pan until brown. Remove from pan and place in a large mixing bowl.
Saute about 0.13 cup of diced onions and 0.13 cup of diced celery in approximately 0.33 tablespoon of butter.
Add around 0.13 tablespoon each of chopped sage, rosemary, and thyme to the pan.
When the mixture is softened, after about 3 minutes, transfer it to the bowl with the sausage.
Add approximately 0.38 cup of crumbled cornbread and 0.38 cup of cubed stale bread to the mixing bowl.
Add about 0.13 cup of chicken stock. If the mixture is too dry, add more stock as needed.

Include approximately 0.13 of a large diced apple, around 0.33 tablespoon of chopped parsley, about 0.13 tablespoon of poultry seasoning, approximately 0.08 teaspoon of salt, and 0.04 teaspoon of ground black pepper.
Add about 0.13 cup of chopped red pepper.
Mix all ingredients thoroughly in the bowl.

original_instructions:
Combine yogurt, green onions and curry powder in bowl. Place potatoes in microwave-safe dish. Add milk. Cover tightly and cook on High until potatoes are tender but not mushy, about 12 minutes. Remove from microwave. Add yogurt mixture to potatoes and mash roughly. Season with salt and pepper. Garnish with parsley.
Combine yogurt, green onions and curry powder in bowl. Place potatoes in microwave-safe dish. Add milk. Cover tightly and cook on High until potatoes are tender but not mushy, about 12 minutes. Remove from microwave. Add yogurt mixture to potatoes and mash roughly. Season with salt and pepper. Garnish with parsley.
ingredients: 2 pounds red potatoes, peeled, cut into eighths
step_by_step_instructions: Combine 0.31 cups plain yogurt, 1 sliced green onion, and 0.13 to 0.25 teaspoons curry powder in a bowl.
Place 8 ounces peeled and cut red potatoes in a microwave-safe dish.
Add 1 tablespoon milk to the potatoes.
Cover tightly and cook on High in the microwave until potatoes are tender but not mushy, about 12 minutes.
Remove potatoes from the microwave.
Add the yogurt mixture to the potatoes and mash roughly.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Garnish with chopped fresh parsley.

original_instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine cereals and nuts in large bowl. Melt butter in saucepan and add seasonings. Drizzle butter mixture over cereal mixture and toss to coat. Season with salt. Bake for 20 minutes. Serve.
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
Combine 0.33 cups of crunchy wheat cereal, 0.33 cups of crunchy corn cereal, 0.33 cups of pretzel nuggets, and 0.17 cups of peanuts in a large bowl.
Melt 1 tablespoon of butter in a saucepan and add 0.17 teaspoons of cayenne, 0.17 teaspoons of chili powder, and 0.17 teaspoons of curry.
Drizzle the butter mixture over the cereal mixture and toss to coat.
Season with salt to taste.
Bake the mixture for 20 minutes.
Serve.

recipe_title: Sugar Snap Peas with Onions and Bacon
original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
In a medium skillet over medium high heat, brown chopped bacon. Using a slotted spoon, remove bacon to a paper towel lined plate. Add onion to the pan. Saute chopped onions 3 minutes or so, until they are just tender. Add peas and water to the pan. Cover and cook peas 5 minutes. Uncover and allow the liquid to cook almost out of the pan. Add bacon back to the skillet and remove pan from heat. Transfer to a serving dish and enjoy!
ingredients: 1 small yellow skinned onion, peeled and chopped
step_by_step_instructions: In a medium skillet over medium-high heat, brown approximately 1 slice of chopped bacon until crispy.
Using a slotted spoon, remove bacon to a paper towel lined plate.
Add about 1/4 of a small chopped yellow onion to the pan.
Saute the chopped onion for about 3 minutes until just tender.
Add approximately 4 ounces of sugar snap peas and 2 tablespoons of water to the pan.
Cover and cook the peas for 5 minutes.
Uncover and allow the liquid to cook almost out of the pan.
Add the bacon back to the skillet and remove the pan from heat.
Transfer to a serving dish and enjoy!

recipe_title: Sichuan Tofu Gan and Warm Celery Salad
original_instructions:
Whisk together the chili oil, chili bean paste and rice vinegar in a small bowl.
Heat a wok over high heat until smoking and pour in the vegetable oil. Add the peppercorns and garlic and toss briefly, and then add the celery and stir-fry until softened, 1 minute. Stir in the tofu and carefully toss until heated through, about 1 minute. Pour in the chili oil sauce and toss well until warm throughout.
Stir in the soy sauce and season with sea salt, black pepper and the lemon juice, adding more to taste.
Transfer to a platter and sprinkle the cilantro and peanuts over the top. Drizzle more chili oil over the salad and serve immediately.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons chili oil, plus more for garnish
3 inner celery stalks, with leaves, sliced diagonally 1/4-inch thick
One 8-ounce package firm tofu gan (dried firm beancurd), sliced into 1/8-inch-thick slices
Sea salt and freshly ground black pepper
1/4 cup coarsely chopped fresh cilantro leaves
step_by_step_instructions: Whisk together 0.50 tablespoon chili oil, 0.25 tablespoon chili bean paste, and 0.25 tablespoon rice vinegar in a small bowl.
Heat a wok over high heat until smoking and pour in 0.25 tablespoon vegetable oil.
Add 0.25 tablespoon Sichuan peppercorns and 0.25 large clove garlic, coarsely chopped, and toss briefly.
Add 0.75 inner celery stalks, sliced diagonally 1/4-inch thick, and stir-fry until softened, 1 minute.
Stir in 2 ounce firm tofu gan, sliced into 1/8-inch-thick slices, and carefully toss until heated through, about 1 minute.
Pour in the chili oil sauce and toss well until warm throughout.
Stir in 0.25 teaspoon light soy sauce and season with sea salt, black pepper, and the juice of 0.125 lemon, adding more to taste.
Transfer to a platter and sprinkle 0.06 cup coarsely chopped fresh cilantro leaves and 0.06 cup roasted salted peanuts over the top.
Drizzle more chili oil over the salad and serve immediately.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Special equipment: 35 to 40 toothpicks
Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F.
Stuff each date with 1 to 2 almonds. Wrap each date with half a piece of bacon and secure with a toothpick.
Bake, turning the dates halfway through so the bacon is evenly cooked, 15 to 18 minutes. Serve warm or at room temperature.
ingredients: 2 pounds thin bacon, cut in half
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F.
Stuff 1 date with 2 almonds.
Wrap the date with half a piece of bacon and secure with a toothpick.
Place in the oven and bake, turning halfway through, for 15 to 18 minutes until bacon is evenly cooked.
Serve warm or at room temperature.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Heat the oil in a large saute pan over a medium heat. Add the onions and cook until they are soft and translucent, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute more. Add tomato sauce, tomato paste, water, vinegar, molasses, pepper and liquid smoke and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 15 minutes. Add chopped chicken, return to a simmer, and cook an additional 10 minutes.
Split rolls. Place a leaf of lettuce on each roll, then pile on 3/4 cup of the chicken mixture onto the roll.
ingredients: 1 whole rotisserie chicken, skin removed, meat shredded into thin strips (about 4 to 4 1/2 cups)
step_by_step_instructions: Heat 0.17 tablespoon canola oil in a large saute pan over medium heat.
Add 0.17 large onion, chopped, and cook until soft and translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add 0.5 clove garlic, minced, and cook for 1 minute more.

Add 2.33 ounce tomato sauce, 0.04 cup tomato paste, 0.08 cup water, 0.06 cup apple cider vinegar, 0.83 tablespoon molasses, 0.04 teaspoon ground black pepper, and 0.08 teaspoon liquid smoke to the pan and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 15 minutes.
Add approximately 0.75 cup shredded chicken to the pan, return to a simmer, and cook for an additional 10 minutes.
Split 1 whole-wheat hamburger roll.
Place 1 large green lettuce leaf on the roll.
Pile on 0.75 cup of the chicken mixture onto the roll.

original_instructions: In a very large pot with heavy lid, layer leeks, kielbasa, baby red potatoes, and parsley. Cover completely with white wine. Add garlic pepper. Add live lobsters. Top with corn on the cob and finally mussels or steamer clams. Cover tightly and cook over a propane cooker on the beach, or on a stovetop over high heat. Watch for steam starting to escape from the pot. When it does, set timer for 20 to 25 minutes. When done, you should smell the kielbasa and the mussels should be open completely. Lobsters should be bright red in color. Lift out dinner ingredients onto bed of seaweed or large platters. Serve in large bowls with melted butter on the side.;
ingredients: 1 leek, cleaned and chopped, or substitute 1 large yellow onion, chopped
2 packages smoked turkey kielbasa, cut into 3-inch pieces
1 (5 pound) bag baby red potatoes, or about 4 to 5 baby red potatoes per person
Large bottle white wine, such as Chablis
4 pounds mussels, or steamer clams, still in shells and washed thoroughly
step_by_step_instructions: Clean and chop 0.08 lb of leek or chop 0.13 lb of yellow onion.
Cut 0.33 lb of smoked turkey kielbasa into 3-inch pieces.
Wash and prepare 0.63 lb of baby red potatoes.
Chop enough parsley to fill 1 tbsp.
In a very large pot with a heavy lid, layer the chopped leeks, kielbasa, baby red potatoes, and parsley.
Pour approximately 1.5 cups of white wine into the pot until the ingredients are covered.
Add 0.17 tbsp of garlic pepper.
Place 1 live Maine lobster into the pot.
Top with 1 ear of shucked corn and 0.33 lb of mussels or steamer clams.
Cover the pot tightly and cook over high heat on a stovetop or propane cooker.
Watch for steam starting to escape from the pot. Once it does, set a timer for 20 to 25 minutes.
Check to ensure the mussels are open completely and the lobster is bright red in color.
Lift out dinner ingredients onto a bed of seaweed or a large platter.
Serve in a large bowl with 0.25 cup of melted butter on the side.

original_instructions:
In a large nonstick frying pan over medium-high heat, fry onion in oil until edges are nicely browned. Add garlic, ginger, and green chile and stir for 1 minute. Mix ground spices with water to form a paste; add to onion mixture. Stir briefly until spices release their fragrance. Add lamb and salt and fry over medium heat, stirring frequently util lamb is cooked through, 10 to 15 minutes. Taste for salt. Stir in lemon juice and remove from heat.
In a large nonstick frying pan over medium-high heat, fry onion in oil until edges are nicely browned. Add garlic, ginger, and green chile and stir for 1 minute.
Mix ground spices with water to form a paste; add to onion mixture. Stir briefly until spices release their fragrance.
Add lamb and salt and fry over medium heat, stirring frequently util lamb is cooked through, 10 to 15 minutes. Taste for salt.
Stir in lemon juice and remove from heat.
ingredients: 1 teaspoon minced green chile (serrano, Thai, or jalapeño)
2 pounds (900g) cubed leg of lamb trimmed of fat (about 4 cups (3/4-inch) cubes)
step_by_step_instructions: In a nonstick frying pan over medium-high heat, fry 0.5 cup (90g) of sliced onion in 0.75 tablespoon of vegetable oil until the edges are nicely browned.
Add 0.25 teaspoon of minced garlic, 0.25 teaspoon of minced ginger, and 0.25 teaspoon of minced green chile to the pan and stir for 1 minute.

Mix 0.75 teaspoon of ground coriander, 0.125 teaspoon of ground cumin, 0.0625 teaspoon of ground red pepper, 0.125 teaspoon of ground black pepper, 0.016 teaspoon of ground turmeric, 0.016 teaspoon of ground cinnamon, and 0.016 teaspoon of ground cloves with 0.5 tablespoon of water to form a paste.
Add the spice paste to the onion mixture and stir briefly until the spices release their fragrance.
Add 0.5 pound (225g) of cubed leg of lamb and 0.25 teaspoon of salt to the pan and fry over medium heat, stirring frequently until the lamb is cooked through, about 10 to 15 minutes.
Taste for salt and adjust if necessary.
Stir in 0.125 teaspoon of fresh lemon juice and remove from heat.

original_instructions: Combine all the ingredients in a large roasting pan and toss thoroughly to coat the potatoes with the seasonings. Cover with plastic wrap and let marinate for 30 minutes. Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Uncover the pan and roast the potatoes for 35 to 40 minutes, until they are golden and crisp. Serve immediately.;
ingredients: 4 cups red bliss potatoes, unpeeled, scrubbed, and cut into 1-inch cubes
1 tablespoon chopped fresh rosemary, or 1 1/2 teaspoons crushed dried
step_by_step_instructions: Combine 1 cup red bliss potatoes, 1 tablespoon olive oil, 0.25 tablespoon chopped fresh rosemary, 0.25 teaspoon paprika, 0.125 teaspoon salt, and 0.125 teaspoon ground black pepper in a large roasting pan.
Toss thoroughly to coat the potatoes with the seasonings.
Cover with plastic wrap and let marinate for 30 minutes.
Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Uncover the pan and roast the potatoes for 35 to 40 minutes, until they are golden and crisp.
Serve immediately.

original_instructions: Heat the oil in a wok over high heat. Add the garlic, ginger, and scallions. Cook until aromatic, about 2 minutes. Add the chicken. Saute until the edges are brown, about 3 to 4 minutes. Add the broccoli, carrots, and green beans to the wok. Cook approximately 5 to 8 minutes, until the vegetables begin to become tender. Add the red pepper, mushrooms, bok choy, and teriyaki sauce to the wok, cook approximately 5 to 8 minutes more, or until chicken is cooked through and vegetables are done to your likeness. Taste and adjust seasonings. Serve immediately.
ingredients: 1 pound boneless, skinless, chicken breasts, sliced into strips
step_by_step_instructions: Heat 0.33 tablespoon sesame oil in a wok over high heat.
Add 0.33 tablespoon minced garlic, 0.33 tablespoon minced ginger, and 0.33 tablespoon minced scallions. Cook until aromatic, about 2 minutes.
Add 0.33 pound boneless, skinless, chicken breasts, sliced into strips. Saute until the edges are brown, about 3 to 4 minutes.
Add 0.33 cup broccoli spears, 0.33 cup julienned carrots, and 0.17 pound green beans, chopped. Cook approximately 5 to 8 minutes, until the vegetables begin to become tender.

Add 0.17 cup julienned red pepper, 0.33 cup quartered button mushrooms, 1 head baby bok choy, chopped, and low sodium teriyaki sauce to the wok. Cook approximately 5 to 8 minutes more, or until chicken is cooked through and vegetables are done to your likeness.
Taste and adjust seasonings. Serve immediately.

original_instructions:
To a large saucepan, combine the Parmesan rinds, carrots, celery, garlic, onions, oregano, thyme, bay leaf and salt. Add 8 cups water and bring to a simmer over medium heat. Simmer the broth for 1 hour 15 minutes, adjusting the heat to maintain a simmer and stirring occasionally to prevent sticking. Strain into a clean saucepan and keep warm over low heat.
Meanwhile, bring a large pot of well-salted water to a boil. Add the tortellini and cook for 2 minutes less than the package instructions, about 4 minutes. Drain well, then add the tortellini to the broth to finish cooking. Stir in the parsley and serve.
ingredients: 1 head garlic, halved across the equator
1 teaspoon salt, plus for pasta water
1 pound spinach pasta tortellini (spinach pasta filled with cheese)
step_by_step_instructions: Combine 2.5 ounces of Parmesan rinds, 0.25 carrot (about 0.5 ounce), 0.25 celery stalk (about 0.5 ounce), 0.5 head garlic, 0.25 onion (about 1 ounce), 1 sprig fresh oregano, 0.5 sprig fresh thyme, 0.25 bay leaf, and 0.25 teaspoon salt in a large saucepan.
Add 2 cups of water and bring to a simmer over medium heat.
Simmer the broth for 1 hour and 15 minutes, adjusting the heat to maintain a simmer and stirring occasionally to prevent sticking.
Strain the broth into a clean saucepan and keep warm over low heat.
Bring a large pot of well-salted water to a boil.
Add 4 ounces of spinach pasta tortellini and cook for about 4 minutes.
Drain the tortellini well, then add it to the prepared broth to finish cooking.
Stir in 0.5 tablespoon of chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley and serve.

recipe_title: Roasted Tomato, Arugula and Mozzarella Salad
original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F.
Add the tomatoes to a shallow 2-quart casserole dish in a single layer.
Toss the tomatoes with the oil, and salt and pepper, to taste. Make sure the tomatoes are cut side up after tossing. Roast until the tomatoes are extremely tender, about 35 to 40 minutes. Remove them from the oven and keep warm.
In a large salad bowl, toss the arugula, mozzarella balls, basil and the warm tomatoes along with any juices from the dish. Drizzle with some good balsamic and season with salt and pepper, to taste.
ingredients: 4 plum tomatoes, cut in 1/2 and seeded
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
One 8-ounce package baby mozzarella balls, drained
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F.
Cut 1 plum tomato in half and seed it.
Add the tomato halves to a shallow baking dish in a single layer.
Toss the tomato halves with 0.38 tablespoon of olive oil, and a pinch of salt and pepper. Make sure the tomatoes are cut side up after tossing.
Roast the tomatoes until they are extremely tender, about 35 to 40 minutes.
Remove the tomatoes from the oven and keep warm.

In a large salad bowl, toss approximately 1.25 ounces of baby arugula, 2 ounces of baby mozzarella balls, 0.06 cup of chiffonade basil leaves, and the warm tomatoes along with any juices from the dish.
Drizzle with a small amount of balsamic vinegar and season with salt and pepper to taste.

original_instructions:
In a large bowl, mix the cabbage and scallions with the mayonnaise, sugar, and hot oil and seasoning. Let sit overnight, or at least 4 hours.
Mix in the peanuts before serving. Serve with an array of smoked fish, raw vegetables, and pickles.
ingredients: 1 bunch scallions, sliced on the bias into 1-inch strips
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
step_by_step_instructions: 1. In a large bowl, mix approximately 2.67 ounces of shredded cabbage with about 0.67 ounces of sliced scallions.
2. Add about 2 tablespoons of mayonnaise, 0.33 teaspoons of light brown sugar, and 0.67 teaspoons of hot chile sesame oil.
3. Season with a pinch of salt and freshly ground black pepper.
4. Let the mixture sit in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours or overnight.
5. Before serving, mix in about 0.67 ounces of peanuts.

original_instructions:
Cut 3/4 of the tomatoes in half, and place in a bowl. Set whole tomatoes aside for garnish.
Arrange basil leaves on each of 4 plates. Top each with 1/4 of the cut tomatoes. Drizzle with olive oil and balsamic vinegar. Garnish with reserved whole tomatoes, the feta cheese, and oregano. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve.
ingredients: Coarse salt and freshly ground pepper
step_by_step_instructions: Cut approximately 3/8 pint of the tomatoes in half, and place in a bowl.
Set a small portion of whole tomatoes aside for garnish.
Arrange about 1/4 cup of basil leaves on a plate.
Top with 1/4 of the cut tomatoes.
Drizzle with a small amount of olive oil and balsamic vinegar.
Garnish with the reserved whole tomatoes, about 1 ounce of feta cheese, and a small amount of oregano.
Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Serve.

recipe_title: Roasted Fingerling Potatoes with Whole Garlic
original_instructions:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
In a large bowl combine all the ingredients and toss. Transfer to a baking sheet and roast for 15 to 20 minutes or until nice and tender.
ingredients: 2 pound fingerling potatoes, washed of any dirt
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.

In a large bowl, combine about 0.33 pound of fingerling potatoes, 2 cloves of garlic (skin on), 0.5 tablespoon of olive oil, leaves from 1 thyme sprig, a pinch of salt, and a pinch of freshly ground black pepper.
Toss the ingredients together until the potatoes are well coated.
Transfer the mixture to a baking sheet, spreading it out evenly.
Roast in the oven for 15 to 20 minutes, or until the potatoes are nice and tender.
